meanings.definition: Relating to or based on phonetics.
meanings.sent1: The phenetic approach focuses on the sounds of words.
meanings.sent2: She took a phenetic approach to studying the pronunciation of foreign languages.
meanings.sent3: The phenetic pronunciation of the word sounded like a funny robot.
meanings.sent4: Her phenetic analysis of the speech patterns was as clear as a bell.
meanings.sent5: The phenetic study of accents made the subject fascinating.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the classification of organisms based on observable similarities and differences.
meanings.sent1: The phenetic grouping of animals was based on their physical traits.
meanings.sent2: Scientists used a phenetic method to categorize the species according to their appearances.
meanings.sent3: The phenetic classification of the animals made them look like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The phenetic comparison of the plants was like finding matching pieces in a complex jigsaw.
meanings.sent5: The phenetic analysis of the species made it easier to understand their relationships.
